title: How to Remove the Smell of Cat Urine from Running Shoes

steps.title: Find a plastic bag large enough to fit the shoes.
steps.content: Find a plastic bag large enough to fit the shoes. It will also need to have enough space to tie up once the shoes are inside.

steps.title: Place a handful of baking soda into the plastic bag.
steps.content: Place a handful of baking soda into the plastic bag. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Place the offending shoes into the plastic bag.
steps.content: Place the offending shoes into the plastic bag.

steps.title: Tie the bag up.
steps.content: Tie the bag up. Shake vigorously to get the baking soda all over the shoes.

steps.title: Leave the shoes in the bag for the next 5 days.
steps.content: Leave the shoes in the bag for the next 5 days. Longer than this is fine too.

steps.title: Remove the shoes outside or somewhere that you can shake them, like the bathroom.
steps.content: Remove the shoes outside or somewhere that you can shake them, like the bathroom . Shake the baking soda off the shoes completely.

steps.title: Place the shoes in the sunshine for a day.
steps.content: Place the shoes in the sunshine for a day. [2] X Research source The sunshine is important, so if it's too cold or raining, place them in a windowsill for the day or more.
